articles.title: Day of UN South-South Cooperation Observed
Film Show Held in Russia
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Pakistan
articles.content:
Film Show Held in Russia 
    Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Maritime Territory of Russia held a film show on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 87th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
 Present at the film show were Pak Phyong Won, chairman of the confederation, Koreans in the territory and an official of the DPRK Consulate General in Nakhodka.    
 The participants watched a Korean film "The Brilliant History of the Great Leadership."

articles.content:
Film Show Held 
    Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Chollima House of Culture in Pyongyang on Friday on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Austria.
 Present there were Vice Chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Hong Son Ok, who is chairwoman of the DPRK-Austria Friendship Association, members of the association and working people in the city.
 Speeches were made there.    
 Then the participants appreciated an Austrian feature film.

articles.content:
Total Repeal of NSL Demanded by Koreans in U.S.
    Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S., the Federation for Independence, Democracy and Reunification in America, the Overseas Headquarters of the Joint Secretariat of the Nationwide Special Committee for Probing the Truth behind the GIs' Massacres, a forum for Korea's reunification and other Koreans' organizations in the U.S. reportedly made public a joint statement on Dec. 4 demanding the total abolition of the "National Security Law (NSL)" in south Korea.
 The successive flunkeyist and traitorous forces have cracked down upon many patriots and infringed upon the rights and freedom of overseas Koreans for the past 56 years after the fabrication of the NSL, the statement said, repeatedly urging the south Korean "National Assembly" to scrap the NSL within this year without fail.
